summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between prosecutors from the New York County District Attorney's Office and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, discussing scheduling calls to discuss a witness or subject related to Leon Black. The emails reference the Ghislaine Maxwell trial and prior conversations with colleagues.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: The email chain's subject line repeatedly references '/ Leon Black', indicating he is the central subject or person of interest in the discussion between the prosecutors.

persons.name: Alissa Wimmer
persons.context: An ADA from the New York County District Attorney's Office who is coordinating with federal prosecutors to schedule a call regarding a conversation about Leon Black.

persons.name: Vanessa Puzio
persons.context: An ADA from the Manhattan District Attorney's Office who is copied on the emails and is part of the team seeking to speak with federal prosecutors.

persons.name: Leah Saxtein
persons.context: A colleague from the Manhattan DA's Office who previously spoke with the federal prosecutors about the subject related to Leon Black.

connections.description: Both are Assistant District Attorneys from the New York County/Manhattan District Attorney's Office working together on the same matter.
Wimmer is attempting to schedule a call with an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the SDNY to discuss a witness/subject related to Leon Black.
Puzio is copied on the correspondence as part of the DA's office team seeking information from the federal prosecutor.

events.title: Scheduled Call Between Prosecutors
events.description: Alissa Wimmer and an AUSA from the SDNY schedule a phone call for 1 PM to discuss a matter related to Leon Black.

events.title: Initial Outreach Regarding Leon Black
events.description: ADA Alissa Wimmer and ADA Vanessa Puzio reach out to an AUSA, stating their understanding that the AUSA had spoken with ADA Leah Saxtein about a subject related to Leon Black.

events.title: Follow-up After Maxwell Trial
events.description: An AUSA informs the DA's office that they have no current plans to interview a witness again, referencing that their office was previously busy with the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

events.title: Rescheduling Attempt for Call
events.description: A flurry of emails attempts to reschedule a call between prosecutors regarding Leon Black, referencing a cancelled prep and an upcoming trial.

locations: New York County District Attorney's Office
Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors from the Manhattan DA's Office are actively seeking information from federal prosecutors (SDNY) regarding a witness or subject connected to Leon Black.
The correspondence indicates prior coordination between the offices, referencing a previous conversation between an SDNY AUSA and Manhattan ADA Leah Saxtein.
The Ghislaine Maxwell trial is cited as a reason for delays in the federal prosecutors' availability or updates on the matter.
The email chain shows persistent efforts by the DA's office to schedule calls over a period from October 2021 to February 2023.
The subject line consistently references 'Leon Black', firmly placing him at the center of the prosecutors' inquiry.
